To the chief Musician on Neginoth upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David. O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.<RF>Sheminith: or, upon the eight<Rf>
Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I <FI>am<Fi> weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.
My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O LORD, how long?
Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies' sake.
For in death <FI>there is<Fi> no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?
I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.<RF>allâ€¦: or, every night<Rf>
Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.<CM>
Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.
The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.
Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return <FI>and<Fi> be ashamed suddenly.<CM>
